thread.title: DeMatha, Quince Orchard, Broad Run up for DMV Game of the Week
thread.title_full: DeMatha, Quince Orchard, Broad Run up for DMV Game of the Week

author: Noah Frank
title: DeMatha, Quince Orchard, Broad Run up for DMV Game of the Week
text:
Home » News » Sports » Local Sports » DeMatha, Quince Orchard, Broad… DeMatha, Quince Orchard, Broad Run up for DMV Game of the Week By Noah Frank | @NoahFrankWTOP October 12, 2015 2:02 am DeMatha beat St. John's in the first DMV Game of the Week, earning their way back into this week's poll. (WTOP/Noah Frank) 
WASHINGTON — Our first DMV Game of the Week was a bruising, defensive struggle for a half before DeMatha’s superior size and health allowed them to run away from St. John’s. What was a 6-0 halftime deficit (and could well have been no worse than a tie game for the Cadets, but for a late interception) turned into a 40-0 rout. 
Thanks to that performance and the schedule dealing another key WCAC rivalry game, DeMatha (6-0) is back among the options for this week’s DMV Game of the Week, as the Stags draw an undefeated Gonzaga (6-0) team at home. 
DeMatha survived its biggest threat of the season last week, escaping with a 52-47 road win over Bishop McNamara, a team Gonzaga beat by 10 earlier this year. The Eagles coasted to a 57-20 win over Bishop O’Connell to set up the biggest WCAC match of the year to date. 
In Maryland, Quince Orchard (5-1) is riding a five-game winning streak in which they’ve outscored every opponent by at least 30 points. The Cougars play host to Germantown’s Northwest (4-2), fresh off a 29-12 victory over Richard Montgomery, the Jaguars’ third win in their last four contests. 
Finally, Ashburn, Virginia’s Broad Run (6-0) takes their undefeated season across town to face Stone Bridge (3-3), fresh off a tough loss. Last year, the Bulldogs earned a 17-9 victory over the Spartans, making this a revenge game for Broad Run as well. 
Vote below by 11:59 p.m. Wednesday to decide this week’s DMV Game of the Week, and email us to nominate future matchups for consideration. Topics:
